quote: That first year, my buddy Danny and I tackled the TUFFER courseâ€”80 miles and 5,000 feet of climbing that, on paper, seemed reasonable. However, the combination of high elevation, loose gravel, and unrelenting wind quickly redefined my sense of 'tuff'.

Over the past decade we have operated on the first weekend of May, we have had great weather 75% of the time and only twice was the weather less than favorable. Always bring good rain gear when visiting the Oregon Coast!
Most of the terrain is new to many riders and has a thrilling twist that has seldom seen a bike tire on.
Five Mile signs will be placed on the long course, and added signs before turns on the course! The GPX file is on the online Ride with a GPS map to download to your Garmin or Wahoo device.
We have over 12 Ham Radio Operators from the Lincoln County Auxiliary Communication Service on course to attempt to break through the hills and revenues of the Siuslaw National Forest.
Custom Medals for all 11 divisions awarded starting at 1:pm and 1:30 pm. Live Music onsite and food vendors to use your 14.00 food voucher.
West Coast Gravel celebrates the explorer in all of us
